Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: RKM Oracle BI (jython)
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION This KM retrieves the table structure in Oracle BI (columns and primary keys).
REQUIREMENTS Requires a Oracle BI data server with the folowwing JDBC property: NQ_SESSION.SELECTPHYSICAL = yes
BASIC CONFIGURATION Requires a Oracle BI data server with the folowwing JDBC property: NQ_SESSION.SELECTPHYSICAL = yes
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) GET_PRIMARY_KEYS: Set to Yes to reverse the primary keys.
(From 12c onwards, all messages will appear in the Log file. The USE_LOG and LOG_FILE_NAME options are no longer required)
LIMITATIONS Due to limitation in the Oracle BI driver, the foreign keys won't be reversed.
Set to Yes to reverse the primary keys.

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang import time import java.util.logging
class SnpsReverse: def __init__(self, iMod, tabPattern, logger): """ Constructor: iMod: MODEL ID value for the current Model to be reversed tabPattern: Table pattern info [Filter, TableType, AliasRemoveChars] srcConnect: Source connection information: [Driver, Url, User, Pass, Catalog, Schema] repoConnect: Repository connection Information: [Driver, Url, User, Pass, Catalog, UnusedSchema]
Example: src = ['com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver', 'jdbc:db2://hydra2u:50000/DB_SNPS', 'db2admin', 'sunopsis', '', 'TRG_DEMO'] repo = ['com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver', 'jdbc:db2://hydra2u:50000/DB_SNPS', 'FX_W_0_1_323', 'FX_W_0_1_323', '', ''] imod = 5111 tabpat = ['%', 'T', 'TRG_'] rev = SnpsReverse(imod, tabpat, src, repo, 1, logfile) rev.startReverse(getcolumns=1, getkeys=1, getfks=1) rev.endReverse() """ self.logger = logger self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Reverse Started.') self.iMod = iMod
self.srccatalog= '<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_CATALOG")%>' self.biee_specific_catalog= self.srccatalog.replace(".", "//") self.srcschema= ''
# get the connection to the source database self.srcCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC")
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Connected.') try: self.srcCx.setAutoCommit(1) except: self.srcCx.setAutoCommit(0)
# get the connection to the repository self.repoCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST")
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Connected.') try: self.repoCx.setAutoCommit(1) except: self.repoCx.setAutoCommit(0)
# Table Pattern information: self.srctabfilter = tabPattern[0] self.jdbctabtype = self.__gettabletype(tabPattern[1]) self.aliasremovechars = tabPattern[2]
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Reverse Options: Model %s - Filter %s - Table Types %s' % (self.iMod, self.srctabfilter, self.jdbctabtype)) ## # intialize source metadata ## self.metadata = self.srcCx.getMetaData() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Driver Name: %s' % self.metadata.getDriverName()) self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Driver Version: %s' % self.metadata.getDriverVersion())
def startReverse(self, getcolumns=1, getkeys=1, getfks=1): """ Public method to start a reverse set getcolumns, getkeys and getfks flags according to what you want to reverse """ self.__gettables(getcolumns=getcolumns, getkeys=getkeys, getfks=getfks)
def endReverse(self): """ Public Method that should be called to release all opened connections """ self.__del__()
def __gettables(self, getcolumns=1, getkeys=1, getfks=1): """ private gettables(): Starts the Reverse of the Tables retrieves columns, keys and fks according to the flags sent as parameters """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, '*** Getting tables List **') tlst = self.metadata.getTables(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, self.srctabfilter,self.jdbctabtype) sql = 'insert into SNP_REV_TABLE (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,RES_NAME,TABLE_ALIAS,TABLE_DESC_C,IND_SHOW,TABLE_TYPE) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?)' ps = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sql) while tlst.next(): try: table_cat = tlst.getString('TABLE_CAT') except: table_cat = '' try: table_schem = tlst.getString('TABLE_SCHEM') except: table_schem = '' try: table_name = tlst.getString('TABLE_NAME') except: table_name = '' try: remarks = tlst.getString('REMARKS') except: remarks = '' ttype = tlst.getString('TABLE_TYPE') table_type = self.__gettabletype2(ttype) if self.aliasremovechars: table_alias = table_name.replace(self.aliasremovechars, '_') else: table_alias = table_name.replace('.','_')
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Table: %s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s %s' % (self.iMod, table_name, table_name, table_alias, remarks, '1', table_type,ttype)) ps.clearParameters() ps.setString(1,self.iMod) ps.setString(2,table_name) ps.setString(3,table_name) ps.setString(4,table_alias) ps.setString(5,remarks) ps.setString(6,'1') ps.setString(7,table_type) ps.executeUpdate() # # Get the columns # if getcolumns: self.__getcolumns(table_name) if getkeys: self.__getkeys(table_name) if getfks: self.__getfks(table_name)
ps.close() tlst.close() self.repoCx.commit()
def __getcolumns(self, tablename): """ private getcolumns: retrieves columns definition of a specified table """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** Getting Columns for table: %s**' % tablename) clst = self.metadata.getColumns(self.biee_specific_catalog, self.srcschema, tablename, '%') sql = 'insert into SNP_REV_COL (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,COL_NAME,COL_HEADING,COL_DESC_C,DT_DRIVER,POS,LONGC,SCALEC,BYTES,COL_MANDATORY,CHECK_FLOW,CHECK_STAT,COL_DESC) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)' ps = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sql)
while clst.next(): coldesc = ""; colpos = 0 coltable = clst.getString("TABLE_NAME") colname = clst.getString("COLUMN_NAME") coldt = clst.getString("DATA_TYPE") coltypename = clst.getString("TYPE_NAME") colsize = clst.getString("COLUMN_SIZE") try: colsize = int(colsize) except: colsize = None coldec = clst.getInt("DECIMAL_DIGITS") colnull = clst.getString("NULLABLE") try: colnull = int(colnull) if (colnull==0) : colnull=1 else : colnull=0 except: colnull = clst.columnNullableUnknown try: colremark = clst.getString("REMARKS") except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> REMARKS not suported by the driver') colheading = colname[-35:] if colremark: colheading = colremark[0:35] try: collen = clst.getInt("CHAR_OCTET_LENGTH") except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> CHAR_OCTET_LENGTH not suported by the driver') try: colpos = clst.getInt("ORDINAL_POSITION") except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> ORDINAL_POSITION not suported by the driver. AutoNumbering.') colpos += 1 colPos=colPos+1 try: colisnull = clst.getString("IS_NULLABLE") if colisnull=='NO': colisnull='0' elif colisnull=='YES': colisnull='1' except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> IS_NULLABLE not suported by the driver. Column set to nullable.') colisnull='0'
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Column: %s, %s, %d, %d, %d, %d, %d, %s' % (colname, coltypename, colpos, colsize, coldec, collen, colnull, colisnull)) # # Apply updates to the DB # ps.clearParameters() ps.setString(1,self.iMod) ps.setString(2,coltable) ps.setString(3,colname) ps.setString(4,colheading) ps.setString(5,colremark) ps.setString(6,coltypename) ps.setInt(7,colpos) ps.setInt(8,colsize) if coldec==-127: ps.setNull(9,java.sql.Types.INTEGER) else: ps.setInt(9,coldec) ps.setInt(10,colsize) ps.setInt(11,colnull) ps.setString(12,'1') ps.setString(13,'1') ps.setString(14,coldesc) ps.executeUpdate() clst.close() ps.close()
def __getkeys(self, tablename): """ private getkeys: retrieves PK definition of a specified table """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** Getting Keys for table: %s**' % tablename) klst = self.metadata.getPrimaryKeys(self.biee_specific_catalog, self.srcschema, tablename)
sqlpk = "insert into SNP_REV_KEY (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,KEY_NAME,CONS_TYPE,IND_ACTIVE,CHECK_FLOW,CHECK_STAT) values (?,?,?,'PK','1','1','1')" sqlpkc = "insert into SNP_REV_KEY_COL (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,KEY_NAME,COL_NAME,POS) values (?,?,?,?,?)"
pspk = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlpk) pspkc = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlpkc)
pkname='' while klst.next(): previouspkname=pkname tablename = klst.getString("TABLE_NAME") colname = klst.getString("COLUMN_NAME") keyseq = klst.getShort("KEY_SEQ") pkname = klst.getString("PK_NAME") if not (pkname): pkname='PK_%s' % tablename
# If a new PK was detected if pkname<>previouspkname: pspk.clearParameters() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Primary Key: %s' % pkname) pspk.setString(1,self.iMod) pspk.setString(2,tablename) pspk.setString(3,pkname) pspk.executeUpdate() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Primary Column: %d, %s' % (keyseq, colname)) pspkc.clearParameters() pspkc.setString(1,self.iMod) pspkc.setString(2,tablename) pspkc.setString(3,pkname) pspkc.setString(4,colname) pspkc.setShort(5,keyseq) pspkc.executeUpdate() pspk.close() pspkc.close() klst.close()
def __getfks(self, tablename): """ private getfks: retrieves FKs definition of a specified table (Imported Keys) """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** Getting Foreign Keys for table: %s**' % tablename) klst = self.metadata.getImportedKeys(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, tablename)
sqlfk = "insert into SNP_REV_JOIN (MOD_GUID,FK_NAME,TABLE_NAME,FK_TYPE,PK_CATALOG,PK_SCHEMA,PK_TABLE_NAME,CHECK_STAT,CHECK_FLOW,IND_ACTIVE) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,'1','1','1')" sqlfkc = "insert into SNP_REV_JOIN_COL (MOD_GUID,FK_NAME,FK_COL_NAME,FK_TABLE_NAME,PK_COL_NAME,PK_TABLE_NAME,POS) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?)"
psfk = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlfk) psfkc = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlfkc)
fkname='' while klst.next(): previousfkname = fkname try: fkname = klst.getString("FK_NAME") except: fkname = '' try: pktablecat = klst.getString("PKTABLE_CAT") except: pktablecat = '' try: pktableschem = klst.getString("PKTABLE_SCHEM") except: pktableschem = '' try: pktablename = klst.getString("PKTABLE_NAME") except: pktablename = '' try: pkcolumnname = klst.getString("PKCOLUMN_NAME") except: pkcolumnname = '' try: fktablecat = klst.getString("FKTABLE_CAT") except: fktablecat = '' try: fktableschem = klst.getString("FKTABLE_SCHEM") except: fktableschem = '' try: fktablename = klst.getString("FKTABLE_NAME") except: fktablename = '' try: fkcolumnname = klst.getString("FKCOLUMN_NAME") except: fkcolumnname = '' try : keyseq = klst.getShort("KEY_SEQ") except: keyseq = '' if fkname <> previousfkname: psfk.clearParameters() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Foreign Key: %s references (%s, %s, %s)' % (fkname, pktablecat, pktableschem, pktablename)) psfk.setString(1,self.iMod) psfk.setString(2,fkname) psfk.setString(3,fktablename) psfk.setString(4,'D') psfk.setString(5,pktablecat) psfk.setString(6,pktableschem) psfk.setString(7,pktablename) psfk.executeUpdate()
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Foreign Key Columns: %d, %s=%s' % (keyseq, fkcolumnname, pkcolumnname)) psfkc.setString(1,self.iMod) psfkc.setString(2,fkname) psfkc.setString(3,fkcolumnname) psfkc.setString(4,fktablename) psfkc.setString(5,pkcolumnname) psfkc.setString(6,pktablename) psfkc.setShort(7,keyseq) psfkc.executeUpdate() psfk.close() psfkc.close() klst.close()
def __gettabletype(self,tabPattern): """ private gettabletype: Returns the JDBC table Type according to the Sunopsis TYpe """ tabletype=[] for snpstype in tabPattern.split(';'): if snpstype=='T': tabletype +=['TABLE'] elif snpstype=='V': tabletype +=['VIEW'] elif snpstype=='ST': tabletype +=['SYSTEM TABLE'] elif snpstype=='AT': tabletype +=['ALIAS'] elif snpstype=='SY': tabletype +=['SYNONYM'] elif snpstype=='QE' :tabletype +=['QUEUE'] elif snpstype=='GT' :tabletype +=['GLOBAL TEMPORARY'] elif snpstype=='LT' :tabletype +=['LOCAL TEMPORARY'] else: tabletype+=['X'] return tabletype
def __gettabletype2(self,tabletype): """ private gettabletype2: Returns the ODI table Type according to the JDBC TYpe """ if tabletype =='TABLE': return('T') elif tabletype =='VIEW': return('V') elif tabletype =='SYSTEM TABLE' : return('ST') elif tabletype =='ALIAS': return('AT') elif tabletype =='SYNONYM': return('SY') elif tabletype =='QUEUE' : return('QE') elif tabletype =='GLOBAL TEMPORARY' : return('GT') elif tabletype =='LOCAL TEMPORARY' : return('LT') else: return('X')
def __del__(self): """ Finalizer: Close all opened connections """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Disconnecting from Source.') if not self.srcCx.isClosed(): self.srcCx.close() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Disconnecting from Repository') if not self.repoCx.isClosed(): self.repoCx.close() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Reverse End.')

imod = '<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>' tabpat = [ '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>', '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>', '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_ALIAS_LTRIM")%>' ] cols = 1 pks = <%=odiRef.getOption("GET_PRIMARY_KEYS")%> fks = 0
# # START THE REVERSE # logger = odiRef.getLogger() rev = SnpsReverse(imod, tabpat, logger) rev.startReverse(getcolumns=cols, getkeys=pks, getfks=fks) rev.endReverse()
